questions.prompt: Present or found almost everywhere simultaneously.
questions.definition: Present or found almost everywhere simultaneously.
questions.sentence: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern professional environments.

questions.prompt: pragmatic
questions.definition: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically based on practical considerations rather than theoretical ideals.
questions.sentence: The senator took a pragmatic approach to healthcare reform, favoring incremental progress over sweeping overhaul.
options: Stubbornly resistant to authority or discipline.
Dealing with things sensibly and realistically based on practical considerations rather than theoretical ideals.
Excessively concerned with minor details or rules.

questions.prompt: The forensic accountant's ___________ record-keeping revealed the fraud scheme within hours.
questions.definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
questions.sentence: The forensic accountant's meticulous record-keeping revealed the fraud scheme within hours.

questions.prompt: To lessen the severity, seriousness, or painfulness of something.
questions.definition: To lessen the severity, seriousness, or painfulness of something.
questions.sentence: The city installed floodwalls to mitigate the damage caused by seasonal storms.

questions.prompt: eloquent
questions.definition: Fluent, forceful, and persuasive in speech or writing; clearly expressing or indicating something.
questions.sentence: Her eloquent closing argument moved several jurors to tears.
options: Fluent, forceful, and persuasive in speech or writing; clearly expressing or indicating something.
Having a ready insight into things; shrewd.

questions.prompt: After months of hardship, the __________ community rebuilt its infrastructure with remarkable speed.
questions.definition: Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
questions.sentence: After months of hardship, the resilient community rebuilt its infrastructure with remarkable speed.

questions.prompt: Lasting only for a short time; impermanent.
questions.definition: Lasting only for a short time; impermanent.
questions.sentence: The philosopher argued that all earthly pleasures are transient and therefore unreliable sources of happiness.

questions.prompt: paradigm
questions.definition: A typical example or pattern of something; a model or framework that shapes understanding within a discipline.
questions.sentence: Kuhn argued that scientific revolutions occur when anomalies accumulate and a new paradigm supplants the old.
options: An object, idea, or event that is out of its proper historical period.
A typical example or pattern of something; a model or framework that shapes understanding within a discipline.
The dominance or leadership of one group over others.

questions.prompt: The dissertation offered a compelling __________ of postcolonial theory and feminist critique.
questions.definition: The combination of elements or ideas into a coherent whole; a complex product formed by combining elements.
questions.sentence: The dissertation offered a compelling synthesis of postcolonial theory and feminist critique.

questions.prompt: Open to more than one interpretation; not having a single clear meaning.
questions.definition: Open to more than one interpretation; not having a single clear meaning.
questions.sentence: The treaty's ambiguous language led to decades of legal disputes between the two nations.

questions.prompt: formidable
questions.definition: Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively powerful, large, or capable.
questions.sentence: The prosecution assembled a formidable array of forensic evidence against the defendant.
options: Behaving in an obedient or excessively compliant manner.
Inspiring fear or respect through being impressively powerful, large, or capable.
Given to excessive and often trivial criticism.

questions.prompt: The diplomat was praised for being __________ in three languages under considerable diplomatic pressure.
questions.definition: Having or showing the ability to speak fluently and coherently; clearly expressed.
questions.sentence: The diplomat was praised for being articulate in three languages under considerable diplomatic pressure.

questions.prompt: Lasting for a very short time; transitory and delicate.
questions.definition: Lasting for a very short time; transitory and delicate.
questions.sentence: The artist captured the ephemeral beauty of cherry blossoms before they fell.

questions.prompt: perfidious
questions.definition: Deceitful and untrustworthy; guilty of betrayal.
questions.sentence: The perfidious adviser secretly shared state secrets with a rival government.
options: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion despite good arguments.
Deceitful and untrustworthy; guilty of betrayal.

questions.prompt: Every office has at least one __________ eager to flatter the manager at every opportunity.
questions.definition: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
questions.sentence: Every office has at least one sycophant eager to flatter the manager at every opportunity.

questions.prompt: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.
questions.definition: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.
questions.sentence: The recalcitrant student refused every intervention the school counselor proposed.

questions.prompt: obsequious
questions.definition: Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree; fawning.
questions.sentence: His obsequious manner disgusted his colleagues, who found his constant flattery transparently self-serving.
options: Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree; fawning.

questions.prompt: Her __________ spending habits made budgeting nearly impossible for the finance team.
questions.definition: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior; impulsive.
questions.sentence: Her capricious spending habits made budgeting nearly impossible for the finance team.

questions.prompt: Causing harm or damage, especially in a way that is gradual or not easily noticed.
questions.definition: Causing harm or damage, especially in a way that is gradual or not easily noticed.
questions.sentence: Prolonged exposure to fine particulates has a deleterious effect on lung function.

questions.prompt: equivocal
questions.definition: Open to more than one interpretation; deliberately ambiguous or unclear.
questions.sentence: The candidate's equivocal statement on the issue pleased neither faction of the electorate.
options: Excessively concerned with small details or academic rules.
Open to more than one interpretation; deliberately ambiguous or unclear.

questions.prompt: The professor's __________ lectures often ran long because he could not resist one more digression.
questions.definition: Tending to talk a great deal; garrulous.
questions.sentence: The professor's loquacious lectures often ran long because he could not resist one more digression.

questions.prompt: Very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or someone less powerful.
questions.definition: Very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or someone less powerful.
questions.sentence: In a magnanimous gesture, the winning team offered to share the prize fund with the runners-up.

questions.prompt: parsimonious
questions.definition: Unwilling to spend money or use resources; extremely frugal to the point of meanness.
questions.sentence: The parsimonious landlord refused to replace the broken heating system despite repeated tenant complaints.
options: Causing harm or damage in a subtle or gradual way.
Unwilling to spend money or use resources; extremely frugal to the point of meanness.
Stubbornly resistant to change or correction.

questions.prompt: Using horse-drawn carriages in a sci-fi film struck critics as a glaring __________ in an otherwise meticulous production.
questions.definition: A thing belonging or appropriate to a period other than that in which it exists; something out of its proper historical time.
questions.sentence: Using horse-drawn carriages in a sci-fi film struck critics as a glaring anachronism in an otherwise meticulous production.

questions.prompt: Hostile and aggressive; inclined to pick quarrels or start fights.
questions.definition: Hostile and aggressive; inclined to pick quarrels or start fights.
questions.sentence: The belligerent faction within the party undermined every attempt at coalition-building.

questions.prompt: circumspect
questions.definition: Wary and unwilling to take risks; carefully considering all circumstances before acting.
questions.sentence: A circumspect investor avoids committing capital until thorough due diligence is complete.
options: Refusing to obey; stubbornly defiant of authority.
Wary and unwilling to take risks; carefully considering all circumstances before acting.
Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.

questions.prompt: The lecture explored the stark __________ between free-market capitalism and centrally planned economies.
questions.definition: A division or contrast between two things that are represented as being opposed or entirely different.
questions.sentence: The lecture explored the stark dichotomy between free-market capitalism and centrally planned economies.

questions.prompt: To make a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling worse.
questions.definition: To make a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling worse.
questions.sentence: The government's austerity measures only served to exacerbate poverty in the region.

questions.prompt: fastidious
questions.definition: Very attentive to accuracy and detail; difficult to please; excessively demanding.
questions.sentence: The fastidious editor returned the manuscript with corrections on every page.
options: Very attentive to accuracy and detail; difficult to please; excessively demanding.
Inclined to express bitter or cruel displeasure.

questions.prompt: The film's __________ violence added nothing to the narrative and alienated much of the audience.
questions.definition: Uncalled for; lacking good reason; unwarranted; done without necessity or justification.
questions.sentence: The film's gratuitous violence added nothing to the narrative and alienated much of the audience.

questions.prompt: Leadership or dominance, especially of one country or social group over others.
questions.definition: Leadership or dominance, especially of one country or social group over others.
questions.sentence: The rise of new economic powers has gradually eroded the hegemony that Western nations once took for granted.

questions.prompt: iconoclast
questions.definition: A person who attacks or criticizes cherished beliefs or institutions; one who challenges established conventions.
questions.sentence: The iconoclast artist rejected every convention of the academy, producing work that initially baffled critics.
options: A person who acts obsequiously to gain advantage.
A person who attacks or criticizes cherished beliefs or institutions; one who challenges established conventions.
A person characterized by excessive self-interest.

questions.prompt: The tyrant's __________ intent was evident in every decree he issued against the minority population.
questions.definition: Having or showing a wish to do evil to others; malicious.
questions.sentence: The tyrant's malevolent intent was evident in every decree he issued against the minority population.

questions.prompt: Wicked or criminal; involving or characterized by criminal wrongdoing.
questions.definition: Wicked or criminal; involving or characterized by criminal wrongdoing.
questions.sentence: The investigative journalist exposed the nefarious network of shell companies used to launder the funds.

questions.prompt: ostentatious
questions.definition: Characterized by a conspicuous, often excessive display intended to impress or attract notice.
questions.sentence: The billionaire's ostentatious yacht featured a helipad, a submarine dock, and a private cinema.
options: Characterized by a conspicuous, often excessive display intended to impress or attract notice.
Stubbornly persistent in maintaining a position.

questions.prompt: Lead paint poses a particularly __________ risk because children may ingest it without obvious symptoms appearing for years.
questions.definition: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
questions.sentence: Lead paint poses a particularly pernicious risk because children may ingest it without obvious symptoms appearing for years.

questions.prompt: Complaining in a petulant or whining manner; habitually finding fault.
questions.definition: Complaining in a petulant or whining manner; habitually finding fault.
questions.sentence: The querulous patient complained about the food, the lighting, and the nurses in equal measure.

questions.prompt: recondite
questions.definition: Not known by many people; abstruse; dealing with obscure subject matter.
questions.sentence: The professor's recondite lectures on Byzantine numismatics attracted a devoted but very small following.
options: Extremely careful and thorough about accuracy.
Not known by many people; abstruse; dealing with obscure subject matter.
Willing to obey; compliant to excess.

questions.prompt: Only a __________ investor recognizes when market enthusiasm has outpaced fundamental value.
questions.definition: Having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment; shrewd.
questions.sentence: Only a sagacious investor recognizes when market enthusiasm has outpaced fundamental value.

questions.prompt: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant.
questions.definition: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant.
questions.sentence: The truculent witness refused to answer questions and openly mocked the prosecuting attorney.

questions.prompt: untenable
questions.definition: Not able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection; not sustainable.
questions.sentence: The minister's position became untenable once the leaked emails contradicted her public statements.
options: Extremely cautious and attentive to risk.
Not able to be maintained or defended against attack or objection; not sustainable.

questions.prompt: Critics noted that the committee tended to __________ on key decisions rather than commit to a clear policy direction.
questions.definition: To waver between different opinions or actions; to be indecisive.
questions.sentence: Critics noted that the committee tended to vacillate on key decisions rather than commit to a clear policy direction.

questions.prompt: Angry and bitter, especially in speech or manner; full of sharp ill will.
questions.definition: Angry and bitter, especially in speech or manner; full of sharp ill will.
questions.sentence: The acrimonious divorce proceedings dragged on for two years, scarring the entire family.

questions.prompt: ameliorate
questions.definition: To make something bad or unsatisfactory better; to improve.
questions.sentence: The new policy was designed to ameliorate the suffering of displaced workers during the economic transition.
options: To worsen or intensify a bad condition.
To make something bad or unsatisfactory better; to improve.
To spread widely through a group or population.

questions.prompt: It was __________ of the young prosecutor to challenge the most celebrated defense attorney in the state.
questions.definition: Showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks; daringly original.
questions.sentence: It was audacious of the young prosecutor to challenge the most celebrated defense attorney in the state.

questions.prompt: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because it is illicit.
questions.definition: Kept secret or done secretively, especially because it is illicit.
questions.sentence: The intelligence agency conducted a clandestine operation to recover the stolen documents.

questions.prompt: egregious
questions.definition: Outstandingly bad; shockingly conspicuous; flagrant.
questions.sentence: The auditor flagged the egregious accounting irregularities that had gone unnoticed for a decade.
options: Extremely cautious and precise in all dealings.
Stubbornly loyal to an established belief.

questions.prompt: The mediator maintained her __________ despite the hostility of both negotiating parties.
questions.definition: Mental calmness and composure, especially in difficult situations.
questions.sentence: The mediator maintained her equanimity despite the hostility of both negotiating parties.

questions.prompt: Unreasonably high in price or demand; exceeding what is considered reasonable.
questions.definition: Unreasonably high in price or demand; exceeding what is considered reasonable.
questions.sentence: The exorbitant fees charged by the consulting firm prompted the board to seek alternative advisers.

questions.prompt: fallacious
questions.definition: Based on a mistaken belief; embodying or containing a fallacy; logically unsound.
questions.sentence: The editorial board rejected the columnist's fallacious reasoning that correlation implied causation.
options: Extremely frugal and reluctant to spend resources.
Based on a mistaken belief; embodying or containing a fallacy; logically unsound.
Inclined toward an unnecessarily confrontational manner.

questions.prompt: The __________ dinner guest dominated every conversation and rarely paused to listen.
questions.definition: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
questions.sentence: The garrulous dinner guest dominated every conversation and rarely paused to listen.

questions.prompt: Deserving of or causing public disgrace or shame; humiliating.
questions.definition: Deserving of or causing public disgrace or shame; humiliating.
questions.sentence: The general's ignominious retreat was broadcast live and became the defining image of the failed campaign.

questions.prompt: insidious
questions.definition: Proceeding in a gradual, subtle way but with harmful effects; deceptively attractive.
questions.sentence: Misinformation spreads in an insidious way, eroding trust in institutions before the damage becomes apparent.
options: Proceeding in a gradual, subtle way but with harmful effects; deceptively attractive.
Having a calm, composed temperament under pressure.

questions.prompt: The __________ tabloid invented a scandal to boost circulation at the politician's expense.
questions.definition: Not telling the truth; lying; habitually dishonest.
questions.sentence: The mendacious tabloid invented a scandal to boost circulation at the politician's expense.

questions.prompt: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action; hardened.
questions.definition: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action; hardened.
questions.sentence: The obdurate negotiator refused every compromise, prolonging the labor dispute by months.

questions.prompt: pedantic
questions.definition: Excessively concerned with minor details or rules, especially as a display of learning.
questions.sentence: His pedantic insistence on correcting every grammatical slip alienated him from colleagues.
options: Characterized by cruel and bitter speech or manner.
Excessively concerned with minor details or rules, especially as a display of learning.
Openly resistant and defiant to authority.

questions.prompt: The __________ heir squandered his inheritance on gambling and lavish parties within a decade.
questions.definition: Recklessly extravagant or wasteful in the use of resources; licentious.
questions.sentence: The profligate heir squandered his inheritance on gambling and lavish parties within a decade.

questions.prompt: Showing great attention to detail or correct behavior; very careful about rules.
questions.definition: Showing great attention to detail or correct behavior; very careful about rules.
questions.sentence: The punctilious archivist catalogued every document with a precision that bordered on obsession.

questions.prompt: sardonic
questions.definition: Grimly mocking or cynical; disdainfully humorous.
questions.sentence: The critic's sardonic review skewered the film's pretensions without offering a single compliment.
options: Grimly mocking or cynical; disdainfully humorous.
Reluctant to speak; reserved in manner.

questions.prompt: The heiress's __________ display of designer labels and private jets struck observers as deeply tasteless.
questions.definition: Behaving or looking as though one thinks one is superior to others; condescendingly arrogant.
questions.sentence: The heiress's supercilious display of designer labels and private jets struck observers as deeply tasteless.
